Description: Pictalk aims to enable non-verbal people communications using AAC resources and Text-to-Speech. Pictalk builds sentences with pictograms you uploaded and pronounces them out loud. You can build virtually any sentence and speak any language !

HelpText1: This button will bring you to your collections menu. It will delete the sentence you are writing.
HelpText2: This button will bring you to your account menu. The account menu let you change your email, language and password.
HelpText3: These buttons will allow you entering in supervisor mode and quit supervisor mode. Supervisor mode is required in order to modify, add or delete pictograms.
HelpText4: This button will delete your current sentence and bring you to the collections menu. Works the same as the "home" button.
HelpText5: This button will delete the last picto in your sentence. If it was a folder, then you go back to the previous screen.
HelpText6: This button will pronounce and speak at loud the sentence you are doing.
HelpText7: This button will copy your current sentence. You can now paste the sentence anywhere !
HelpText8: Sometimes you will need to press this button to fetch your latest pictograms :) Let's say you have added 10 pictograms in your computer and they don't show up in your kid"s phone : Hit this button in his phone and it will fetch all the recent pictograms and data you uploaded !
HelpText9: This button will bring you to the public collections.
HelpText10: This button will you to the collections shared with you
HelpText11: This button will you to your sidebar collections.
HelpText12: This button will log you out
PasswordValidationMessage: At least one capital letter, one digit and a password minimum length of 8
FetchingPictos: Fetching the latest pictograms in the background ...
HomeFeature1: All your images/pictograms are saved in the cloud
HomeFeature2: You can install the app from your computer or phone and tablet
HomeFeature3: Works with all platforms, as simple as that
HomeFeature4: It can virtually speak any language
HomeFeature5: Unlimited number of pictograms and collections
HomeFeature11: Access instantly more than 10 000 pictograms in one click
OpenSourceAndFreeText1: All of the code is open sourced on
OpenSourceAndFreeText2: . You can of course contribute or share ideas and upgrades. Because we really want everyone to have a chance to communicate, PicTalk is free and I will try to grant users as much storage space as they need. Unfortunately, We're just two students and can't spend too much money on servers if PicTalk user base grows. That's why, if you are using PicTalk and like it, feel free to donate please. Thank You!
SupervisorModeSuccess: You are now in supervisor mode, congrats :D
DeleteItem: Are you sure you want to delete:
PleaseType2: in order to delete the item.
Slogan: "Because talking is a right and not a service, Pictalk is free and open-sourced."
Communicate_IRL: Pictalk is great at real time applications: It can speak out loud a sentence composed by several pictograms. Because it was designed with ergonomy in mind, it is quite easy to make sentences on the fly.
Communicate_Messages: Because messaging is becoming as important as talking, Pictalk allows to you to copy the pictograms and the sentence and send them in your favourite messaging applications.
MissingImage: There is no image to upload
SharingExplanation: Pictograms shared by those content creators will apprear directly in your home screen and not only your 'Shared with me' collection
DescriptionNews: Pictalk development News,providing free speech for all. Based on AAC pictograms and TTS.

InstallAnotherBrowserText: Please use Pictalk on Chrome or Firefox in order to have the best experience. Browsers like Safari tend to have less support for Text-To-Speech and other modern features.
HomeText1: Pictalk is a free and open-source application that aims to offer a simple way of speaking to the non-verbal people.
HomeText2: Pictalk uses augmentative and alternative communication systems such as the ones provided by the ARASAAC non-profit organization, but also photos and converts them into out loud speech. Pictalk is made for individuals but also for families and community life because the collections can be shared across devices, users and user groups. Pictalk uses Text-To-Speech voices that are natively present on your device to pronounce the constructed sentences.
HomeText3: The adventure started back in 2019 with my studies of Telecommunication engineering. The idea to create a simple application to help my non-verbal little brother was an evidence. The first version of Pictalk appeared and I was awarded a price for it. When my other brother joined the engineering school, he wanted to be part of this heartfelt project. Now, we're a team of two yound developers behind Pictalk and we're as motivated as ever to make speech a fundamental right.
CollectionNotExplored: The collection hasn't been explored yet... Please reconnect to the internet to view its contents
EmptyCollection: The collection is empty... You can create pictograms or collections by pressing the lock button.
TooltipSidebar: The sidebar let you place pictograms with more freedom
PublicBundleDescription: Select a public bundle to import it into your new account. With this, you will start with a ready-to-talk account.
PublicBundleLevelADescription: Level A bundle is the most basic setup. It's based on situational communication. The pictograms are stored in function of the context they are going to be used. For example, the food collection is where you will find all the food related pictograms.
AlexInfos: President and founder of the Pictalk organization.
AdriInfos: Hi, I'm madly in love with web development and I want my little brother to talk üî•üíØ
ClementInfos: I really wanted to join the Pictalk adventure and I'm happy to be able to contribute to it today.
GuillemineInfos: Hello there ! I'm a developper for Pictalk, and I'm currently working on new ideas for the future
ArmandInfos: I have the will to use my passion for tech in order to help people in need
CharlineInfos: I want to bring a fresh look to Pictalk in order to best communicate its mission to the public
AreDevelopper: You are a developer and want to help out ?
AreDevelopperText: If you are a developper and want to help us out ? Go to our Github page and pick an issue ! Clone our repo and do a pull request once the code is complete. You can also create an issue if you want to make a suggestion.
AreHealthPro: You are a health professional and want to help out ?
AreHealthProText: You have communication learning skills or work in the health care system ? You can suggest modifications or improvements of Pictalk. You can also help us by working on the 'Public' collections.
AreParticular: You are a user or a parent and you want to help ?
AreParticularText: Talk about Pictalk around you and give us some visibility ! You can of course suggest modifications and help us financialy.
thanksDonations: All the team thanks you for your donations üòç!
DonationBankText: Mandatory if we want to run our non-profit organization.
DonationOtherText: Domain name, Security and other ponctual services
DonationGoals: If we would have more money we could...
DonationGoalsText1: Pay an orthophonist to help us build the public collections. Public collections are an essential entry point to new users. Having nice and numerous bundles of pictograms will help new users start using Pictalk and will inspire them.
DonationGoalsText2: Hire a developper in order to relieve the pressure put on our small team and to improve Pictalk. One person more could help us presenting Pictalk to new establishements and to accompany new users.
AccountSupervisorAdd: Add a user as a supervisor for your account
SignupSupervisorText: Caution, following users will have full control over your personal collection:
AccountSupervisorText: Share this link to a non existing Pictalk user. When signin up, you will automatically be added to his supervisor list.
AuthorizationError: There was an authorization error sharing the collection
CouldNotShare: Could not share the collection to some users (they may be invalid)
CanTranslateText: You can also help us translate the application languages. The translations are mostly automated and they may be incorrect. Everyone is welcomed to correct or add another language to Pictalk.
INSALyonSponsoring: The INSA Lyon foundation helped us with 1000‚Ç¨ donation support

ARASAACSponsoring: The ARASAAC non-profit organization provides us free and open source pictograms
PronounceShowSize: Size of pictograms during speaking time
PictoStepsCreationError: Error while trying to create the collection or pictogram
NoVoiceAvailable: No voice available in your device
SignupNoVoiceText: You can still use Pictalk but you won't be able to hear the sentences. You can still use the pictograms to communicate. Pictalk may not function as usual. Please install a voice with the help of following links:
TutorialsBasicsText: In this tutorial you will learn how to use Pictalk. We will show you how to navigate between collections and make a sentence.
TutorialsCreation: Creation, edition and removal of pictograms and collections
TutorialsCreationText: In this tutorial you will learn how to create, edit and remove pictograms and collections. At the end of the vide, you will know how to create a new collection and how to add pictograms to it. You will see how to edit an image within Pictalk too.
TutorialsOrganizingText: In this tutorial you will learn how to organize pictograms and collections. At the end of the video, you will easily master Pictalk most powerful organizing tools like the drag and drop.
FeedbackSocials: If you need some help, you can also post a message on our social networks:
DragAndDrop: Drag and drop to other collections
TutorialsSharingText: In this tutorial you will learn how to share pictograms and collections. At the end of the video, you will know how to share a collection with other users and how to integrate shared collections to your own personnal space.
